definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: Firecrackers exploded, flags flew high, and cars honked wildly.
sentences.chinese: 炮聲陣陣，旗幟飛揚，就連汽車的喇叭都摁得朝天響。

sentences.english: To get a pulse, I put my finger in a bullet hole.
sentences.chinese: 我把手指摁在子彈孔上，還有一絲脈搏的跡象。

sentences.english: But this time YOU hold the pigeon down and I'll crap on its head!
sentences.chinese: 不過這回你來摁住鴿子，我在它頭上拉屎。

sentences.english: The old man tamped down some more tobacco into his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 老人又把一些菸絲摁進菸斗。

sentences.english: One of them is the technique you saw me do with my left hand where I wiggled it a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 其中一種就是我稍稍擺動我摁弦的左手，這種叫顫音。

sentences.english: It's difficult to leave players on the bench who are playing extraordinarily well.
sentences.chinese: 把發揮得非常好的球員摁在替補板凳上可不容易。

sentences.english: She put the forked end over Samie's neck and pinned him to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 她用晾衣杆叉住薩米的脖子，把它摁在地上。

sentences.english: This black key will not sound.
Normally we do not give any discounts, for the prices have already been greatly reduced.
sentences.chinese: 通常我們是不打折扣摁爲價錢已經減得很低。

sentences.english: You can turn the button on.
sentences.chinese: 你可以摁一下開機的按鈕。

sentences.english: Can be achieved by two digital press function key to real numbers.
sentences.chinese: 可以實現兩個數碼管通過摁鍵來現實數字的功能。

sentences.english: All that's left to do is press the button and the autopilot takes charge.
sentences.chinese: 剩下的摁一下鈕，交給自動導航就行了。

definition: to pick (flowers)/to pinch/to nip/to pinch off/to clutch/(slang) to fight
to press down/to press a button
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
erhua variant of 使勁|使劲[shi3 jin4]
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
